name: Monopati Rooms & Apartments

reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 nights at Monopati's "Little House" with our 2 adult children. We arrived with high expectations and were not disappointed. There is beauty and serenity at any time of day: from the relaxing and delicious breakfast on Isabelle's terrace in the morning, to the flowers, gorgeous views of the old town and beautiful blue sea, to evening's absolute quiet–no cars!-moonlight, and stars. Our lodgings were spotlessly clean, quiet, and comfortable. We cooked our dinners and enjoyed them out on the terrace overlooking the sea. Be sure to go down to the sea for a swim and up the hill to explore the upper town. I recommend traveling light as it is a bit of a steep walk uphill to Monopati and the path a bit rocky, but it's worth it! Our conversations with Isabelle and Chris also made the visit very special, and we are grateful for their gracious hospitality.
reviews.title: Beauty all day long

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Monemvasia is one of the most beautiful places in the world in my opinion. Remote and untouched, it remains as one of the last vestiges of a Greece before the days of large hotels, chain restaurants and tourists on every corner. The cobbled streets, local culture and swimming platform have given me some of my favorite and most cherished memories. It might not be for everyone, however. Its quaint and sleepy. The rocky platform is the only beach. Televisions are discouraged and cell reception non-existent. But to me that makes it all the better.
reviews.title: Somewhere I go back to time and time again

reviews.text: For me Monopati is the only place to stay in the Castro. The proprietor prides herself on giving a level of service that exceeds the other establishments around. She will go above and beyond to make sure that your stay is perfect and provides a local knowledge that will totally transform your trip. The rooms are clean and pleasant and the breakfast, fresh but what makes this place is the view. Straight out onto the blue sea, the high position in the town meets there is nothing in your way. You feel like you could jump out into the cold water.
reviews.title: Monopati....paradise AND a spectacular view.....

reviews.text: Preface: words can never capture the feeling...
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodation, Great Location and Super Friendly Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you arrive in Monemvasia, a well-kept secret from everyone but Greeks apparently, you instantly feel the magic wrap itself around you. The Kastro (citadel) is 12th Century. Medieval churches everywhere of course, but even in my guesthouse, Monopati, everything that looked brand-new or restored was actually original; the wooden beams of the ceiling, the terracotta floor tiles, the extraordinary archways between rooms and outlining windows. The owner, Isabelle, an amazing woman, has put some wonderful finishes on things, painstakingly selecting colors that just make the rooms smile at you.
reviews.title: Beautiful, romantic and ancient history...

reviews.text: Isabel makes the stay at Monopati Rooms a special experience. She is a charming, wonderful host who shared many fascinating insights into the town she knows & loves so well. We stayed in the apartment which was comfortable but it is on different floors and, therefore, has many stairs. Delicious breakfasts were a wonderful way to begin the day before setting out to explore Monemvasia; a Byzantine town of great unspoilt beauty, magnificently situated. The 14th century icon in the Church of Elkonmenos is exceptional and not to be missed.
reviews.title: A special place

reviews.text: We stayed in the 90 sq. meters appartment and it was just perfect. The room was spotless clean, and you could find everything you could think of. Even books to read, cd to listen... No TV available which was in full compliance with the environment. The kitchen was fully equipped with everything you needed for a breakfast. The only minus was that it was not refilled (we did not get another milk and since we did not finished anything else I cannot say if they would refill it). No air condition in the rooms. Only in the living room where there was aircon + fire place + fan. However we did not need any, even it was the last weekend of October. Isabelle was very helpful. The location of the appartment is ideal since it is very close to the bridge. Isabelle has also provided with maps, walking tours, pizza delivery leaflet,etc. If you can avoid it don't eat in the castle. Very expensive for the quality you get. Definitely try the omelette at the cafe opposite Kanoni restaurant. Go to Gerakas (a small village) around 20 km far from Monemvasia where you can eat fish by the lake.
reviews.title: Emphasis on the detail

reviews.text: We spent one night in the Little House at Monopati in Monemvasia and it was lovely. The house itself is comfortable and nicely decorated, though spread out on 4 levels so (as for Monemvasia itself) only for those who can handle many stairs! Monemvasia is pedestrian-only so you must park your car outside the city walls and walk in. To get to Monopati, you need to walk up many steps, but it is perfectly located in the center of Monemvasia, so you can walk up to the fort at the top (you're already halfway there!) or down to "town" easily. The bedrooms are unusual: the main bedroom in on the lowest level and is a bit cave-like, with one window that either is left with the curtains open (leading me to think a passerby could see in) or curtained and very dark. The kids' bedroom had two single beds on themselves two different levels. All the beds were comfortable, though, and the bathroom, though small, was clean and bright. Isabelle served us a delicious breakfast in her kitchen (too windy for the terrace that day) with homemade jams and preserves. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Isabelle is a great host!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of spending two nights with Isabelle at Monopati Rooms this past April, and it was one of the most memorable stops of our trip. Our room was a two bedroom apartment, with our own entrance, terrace and kitchen.
reviews.title: Beautiful unforgettable trip to Monemvasia

reviews.text: We spent two relaxing days wandering through the streets and fields of Monemvasia's upper and lower town, sitting on our terrace reading and drinking local wine, and having long meals at some of the local restaurants (all walking distance from the apt). The apartment is in an ideal location, tucked up above the main "street", and extremely quiet. Isabelle provided us with a delicious breakfast every morning on our terrace, overlooking the town and ocean, and was a fantastic host. Lots of stairs to climb (pack light!!), but that was to be expected!
reviews.title: Incredible historic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've just returned from Monemvasia. What a fascinating place!
reviews.title: Calm, quiet, and hospitality on the Rock.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reading the different reviews from TripAdvisor, I was about to fall into the trap and miss overnighting on the Rock. What a big mistake that would’ve been, and my wife would have never forgiven me. The experience of sleeping in a medieval town, away from the noise and bustle of modern life, is unique. You can find plenty of places like mainland Gefyra all over Greece. But nothing like the citadel on the Rock. It’s the only reason to go to Monemvasia in the first place!
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long hesitation because of some of the reviews about the citadel, we chose to spend a few days there and went to Monopati Rooms & Apartments. Fast and efficient.
reviews.title: Absolutely Spectacular

likes.liked: — Spacious, beautiful room in excellent location; great service

reviews.text: We crossed over the bridge and when we got to the citadel gate, Isabelle - the owner - came down to welcome us. She organized somebody to carry the luggage. We spent five enchanting days with Isabelle and her husband Christos and felt very much at home.
reviews.title: Rejuvenate, Recharge and Relax-Do it all at Monopati

likes.liked: — The warmth and welcoming nature of our hosts

description: Monopati Rooms & Apartments, a traditional guesthouse in the heart of the Kastro of Monemvasia, South Peloponnese a hybrid between a b&b and a self-catering house.Located in the heart of the Byzantine Citadel of Monemvasia and nestled in pristine surroundings, the « Monopati Rooms and Apartments», an enchanting and rustic residence, invites you to settle down and relax, taking in the unique atmosphere.The houses have been restored with natural materials, blending the advantages of modern comfort with the authenticity of their medieval origins.We offer two different kinds of accommodation at a reasonable price; ideal for honeymoons, family vacations, a gathering of friends or to visit on your own.Here time has no meaning. The day starts with a generous breakfast served on our terrace, overlooking the deep blue Aegean Sea.Open from late February till early November, we encourage you to visit us also in the greenery of spring, as well as in the beautiful sunny days of late fall when after the first rains, a second spring blooms...In the end, we always arrive at the place where we are expected... from José Saramago
